remarks: The inverse of a matrix is the adjunct of the matrix multiplied with the inverse of the determinant of the matrix if the determinant is a unit in the underlying ring.  Proposition 4.16 in [Lang] p. 518.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 17-Jul-2018.)
